meta.region: Metro Vancouver to Fraser Valley, BC

notes.hours_disclaimer: Hours may vary; verify before visiting especially for volunteer-run stores
notes.tier_methodology: Tiers based on catchment demographics, estate donation likelihood, and reseller competition

stores.name: Value Village - South Vancouver
stores.notes: Largest VV in Vancouver. High volume, high turnover. Basement has cheap kids clothes and housewares. Benefits Big Brothers.

stores.name: Value Village Boutique - South Granville
stores.notes: Boutique format - clothing/accessories only, smaller but curated. Affluent catchment. No donations accepted at location.

stores.name: Value Village Boutique - Downtown Granville
stores.notes: Newer boutique format. Downtown location - mixed catchment. No donations.

stores.name: Value Village - Burnaby Edmonds
stores.notes: Good volume. Mixed demographics in catchment area.

stores.name: Value Village - Coquitlam Barnet
stores.notes: Newer location. Good selection, less picked over than Vancouver stores.

stores.name: Value Village - Coquitlam United Blvd
stores.notes: Large store with furniture section upstairs.

stores.name: Value Village - Richmond
stores.notes: Pulls from affluent Richmond areas. Good for quality items. Worth the trip.

stores.name: Value Village - Surrey Whalley
stores.address: 10642 King George Blvd, Surrey, BC V3T 2X3
stores.notes: High volume but heavily picked over. Mixed catchment.

stores.name: Value Village - Surrey Newton
stores.address: 6925 King George Blvd, Surrey, BC V3W 5A1
stores.notes: High volume store. Competition from resellers.

stores.name: Value Village - Maple Ridge
stores.notes: Suburban store. Less competition, decent finds.

stores.name: Value Village - Langley
stores.notes: Suburban location. Benefits Diabetes Canada.

stores.name: Value Village - Abbotsford
stores.address: 31970 South Fraser Way, Abbotsford, BC V2T 1V6
stores.notes: Large store. Mixed demographics. Benefits Diabetes Canada.

stores.name: Value Village - Mission
stores.notes: Smaller store. Less competition but also less volume.

stores.name: Value Village - Chilliwack
stores.notes: Off Highway 1. Benefits Diabetes Canada. Older demographic in catchment - potential vintage.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Mount Pleasant
stores.notes: Huge, well-stocked. Less aggressive pricing than VV. Good for vintage.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Kitsilano
stores.notes: Affluent Kitsilano catchment. Higher quality donations.

stores.name: Salvation Army - West Broadway
stores.notes: Good location. Kitsilano/Point Grey donations.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Kerrisdale
stores.notes: EXCELLENT. Affluent Kerrisdale catchment. Estate donations common. Priority stop for vintage.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Marpole
stores.notes: Large store. Good hours. Marpole/South Van catchment.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Lower Lonsdale
stores.notes: North Shore catchment. Good quality potential.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Capilano
stores.address: 1451 Fell Ave, North Vancouver, BC V7P 2K2
stores.notes: EXCELLENT. Upper Capilano/Lynn Valley wealthy catchment. High estate donation potential. Priority stop.

stores.name: Salvation Army - West Vancouver
stores.address: 1582 Marine Drive, West Vancouver, BC V7V 1H8
stores.notes: EXCELLENT. West Vancouver is one of wealthiest areas in Canada. Designer potential high. Priority stop.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Port Kells
stores.notes: Suburban location. Worth checking.

stores.name: Salvation Army - Abbotsford
stores.notes: Abbotsford location. Worth checking on Fraser Valley trips.

stores.name: MCC Vancouver Thrift Shop
stores.notes: South Vancouver location near Fraser/43rd. In operation 35+ years. Conservative pricing. Estate donations. Small cube van for furniture pickup.

stores.name: MCC Centre Thrift Shop
stores.notes: LARGE - 32,000 sq ft. One of biggest thrift stores in BC. Amalgamated from two previous stores. Same location as Ten Thousand Villages. Worth the trip.

stores.name: MCC Clothing Etc.
stores.address: 31872 South Fraser Way, Abbotsford, BC V2T 1V3
stores.notes: Clothing focused. Conservative pricing.

stores.name: Mission MCC Thrift
stores.notes: Mission location.

stores.name: MCC Chilliwack Thrift Shop
stores.notes: Chilliwack MCC. Conservative pricing.

stores.name: VGH Thrift Store
stores.notes: Vancouver General Hospital Auxiliary. Estate donations from East Van/Burnaby. PRIORITY for jewelry - volunteers often underprice precious metals.

stores.name: Lions Gate Hospital Auxiliary Thrift Shop
stores.notes: EXCELLENT. North Shore hospital auxiliary = wealthy donor base. HIGH PRIORITY for jewelry and vintage. Estate donations common.

stores.name: Langley Memorial Hospital Auxiliary Thrift Store
stores.notes: Well-established auxiliary. Both Big Store and Clothing Store at location. Good for jewelry - volunteer pricing.

stores.name: Superfluity Thrift Shop - Peace Arch Hospital
stores.address: 15163 Prospect Ave, White Rock, BC V4B 2R4
stores.notes: EXCELLENT. Operating since 1952. White Rock/South Surrey affluent retiree catchment. Very limited hours - plan accordingly. HIGH PRIORITY for fine jewelry and vintage.

stores.name: Chilliwack Hospital Auxiliary Thrift Shoppe
stores.notes: WARNING: Closing end of April 2025 due to rent increases. Visit soon if still operating. Small volunteer-run shop with good jewelry potential.

stores.name: Still Fabulous - Main Street
stores.notes: BC Children's and BC Women's Hospital auxiliary. Boutique feel at thrift prices. Specializes in clothing/accessories - no housewares. Good for designer finds.

new_west_burnaby.name: New Westminster / Burnaby
new_west_burnaby.notes: Home base area. Good for quick visits.

vancouver_east.name: East Vancouver
vancouver_east.notes: High density of stores. Good for deep dive day.

vancouver_west.name: West Vancouver / Kitsilano / Kerrisdale
vancouver_west.notes: PRIORITY CLUSTER. Affluent catchments. Best for vintage and designer.

vancouver_west_richmond.name: Marpole / Richmond
vancouver_west_richmond.notes: Good value cluster. Richmond VV pulls from affluent areas.

north_shore.name: North Vancouver / West Vancouver
north_shore.notes: PRIORITY CLUSTER. Wealthiest demographics in region. Worth dedicated trip. Bridge traffic - avoid rush hour.

tricities.name: Coquitlam / Port Coquitlam / Port Moody / Maple Ridge
tricities.notes: Growing suburban area. Less picked over than Vancouver.

surrey.name: Surrey / White Rock
surrey.notes: VV locations heavily picked over. Exception: Superfluity in White Rock is excellent but limited hours.

langley_abbotsford.name: Langley / Abbotsford / Mission
langley_abbotsford.notes: Worth dedicated trip. MCC Centre Abbotsford is one of largest thrift stores in BC.

chilliwack.name: Chilliwack / Hope
chilliwack.notes: Long drive but less competition. Older demographic = vintage potential. Combine stores for efficient trip.

weekly_primary.rationale: Highest quality catchments. Worth frequent visits.

biweekly_secondary.description: Good stores to rotate through every 1-2 weeks

monthly_fraser_valley.rationale: Worth dedicated trip monthly. Less competition.

quarterly_chilliwack.rationale: Long drive but unique finds. Older population = vintage potential.
